# sourceRect

**Instance Property**

The area in the source view in which you anchor the popover.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var sourceRect: CGRect { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to define the rectangle that the popover’s arrow points to. The rectangle must be in the coordinate space of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPopoverPresentationController/sourceView].

In iOS 13.2 and later, the default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGRectNull], which instructs the system to use the current frame of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPopoverPresentationController/sourceView]. The controller observes changes to this frame and updates the popover accordingly.

In iOS 13.1 and earlier, the default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreFoundation/CGRect/zero] (Swift) or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGRectZero] (Objective-C); using [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGRectNull] results in undefined behavior.

[doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPopoverPresentationController] ignores this property if you set the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPopoverPresentationController/barButtonItem] property.

## Specifying the popover’s anchor point

- **sourceItem**: The item on which to anchor the popover.
- **UIPopoverPresentationControllerSourceItem**: A type that can be an anchor for a popover presentation controller.
- **sourceView**: The view containing the anchor rectangle for the popover.
- **barButtonItem**: The bar button item on which to anchor the popover.
